intro: Camissoniopsis cheiranthifolia subsp. cheiranthifolia, commonly known as the Sierra velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The species is characterized by its hairy, lobed leaves and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. The plant is adapted to cool, temperate climates and is often found in mountainous regions of California and Oregon.
